intro: Mapania camerunensis, commonly known as the Cameroon mapania, is a flowering plant native to Cameroon. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in West African biodiversity.
